html:
PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 2010-02892010-03-11,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  HEALTH
ActControlled Drugs and Substances Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Marihuana Medical Access Regs
PrecisRegulations Amending the MARIHUANA MEDICAL ACCESS REGULATIONS in order to respond to the invalidation of section 54.1 of the MMAR by the British Columbia Supreme Court’s in Beren . v. AGC. The invalidation of this provision no longer authorized the Government to limit the number of licences to produce marihuana for medical purposes that could be issued in reference to the same production site. The amendments introduce a new limit of a maximum of four (4) licences of production that can be issued for the same production site.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2010-0063 Publication Date: 2010-03-31
AttachmentsAttachment
subject: Regulations Amending the Marihuana Medical Access Regs
precis: Regulations Amending the MARIHUANA MEDICAL ACCESS REGULATIONS in order to respond to the invalidation of section 54.1 of the MMAR by the British Columbia Supreme Court’s in Beren . v. AGC. The invalidation of this provision no longer authorized the Government to limit the number of licences to produce marihuana for medical purposes that could be issued in reference to the same production site.  The amendments introduce a new limit of a maximum of four (4) licences of production that can be issued for the same production site.
